identity.name: E1
identity.mission: Create a 'Level Devil' inspired platformer that feels like a dangerous, high-stakes digital artifact, not a website.
aesthetic_goals: No standard SaaS UI patterns. Everything must feel like a game HUD.
High contrast: Deepest Void Black vs. Blinding Neon.
Motion is mandatory: UI elements must slide, glitch, or bounce like game physics.
Typography must be machine-like and aggressive.

primary_font.name: Chakra Petch
primary_font.usage: Headings, Buttons, Level Titles, 'GAME OVER' screens

secondary_font.name: Rajdhani
secondary_font.usage: Body text, Leaderboard data, Tooltips, Editor UI

rules: Use UPPERCASE for all interactive buttons and section headers.
Headings should have tight tracking (-0.02em) to feel compact and sturdy.
Data numbers (scores, times) must use tabular-nums for alignment.

usage_rules: Use 'Danger Red' (#FF003C) for traps, spikes, and 'Delete' actions.
Use 'Neon Cyan' (#00F0FF) for the player character, primary buttons, and active states.
Use 'Neon Lime' (#39FF14) for the goal/finish line and success messages.
Glassmorphism should be dark and tinted: bg-black/40 with backdrop-blur-md and a 1px border of primary_dim.

visual_enhancers.borders: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.1) or active borders with neon glow.
textures: Subtle scanline overlay (CSS repeating-linear-gradient) on the main background.
Grid pattern (CSS radial-gradient dots or lines) to denote 'virtual space'.
shapes: Chamfered corners (clip-path: polygon(...)) for buttons and cards.

structure.game_container: Centered, fixed aspect ratio (e.g., 16:9), surrounded by distinct UI 'HUD'.
structure.main_menu: Central axis. Big title. Play button pulsing. Background is a slow-moving geometric loop.
structure.level_select: Bento Grid. Cards are square or 2:1 rectangles. Hover effects expand the card slightly.
structure.editor: Canvas in center. Toolbar floating on left (glass). Properties panel on right (glass).

layout.spacing: Generous. Use 'gap-8' or 'gap-12' between major sections. Inside HUDs, keep it tight ('gap-2') for functional grouping.
layout.grid_system: Use CSS Grid for everything. 'grid-cols-12' for main layouts. 'grid-cols-auto-fit' for level lists.

ui_elements.name: GameButton
ui_elements.description: Primary action button. Large, chamfered corners, neon border. Hover: fills with neon color, text turns black. Click: scales down (0.95).
ui_elements.style_classes: relative px-8 py-4 bg-transparent border-2 border-primary text-primary font-chakra font-bold text-xl uppercase tracking-widest hover:bg-primary hover:text-black transition-all duration-75 hover:shadow-[0_0_20px_rgba(0,240,255,0.6)] clip-path-chamfer

ui_elements.name: LevelCard
ui_elements.description: Represents a level. Dark glass background. Shows level number big. Shows 'best time' small. Lock icon if locked.
ui_elements.style_classes: group relative aspect-square bg-surface/50 border border-white/10 hover:border-primary/50 flex flex-col items-center justify-center transition-all hover:scale-105 overflow-hidden

ui_elements.name: NeoInput
ui_elements.description: For editor or settings. Underlined or minimalist box. No default browser styles.
ui_elements.style_classes: bg-transparent border-b-2 border-white/20 focus:border-primary text-white font-rajdhani px-2 py-1 outline-none transition-colors

game_elements.name: PlayerBlock
game_elements.visual: Simple square. Neon Cyan fill. Slight trail effect (particle system) when moving.

game_elements.name: TrapSpike
game_elements.visual: Triangle. Danger Red fill. Pulsing opacity.

game_elements.name: GoalPortal
game_elements.visual: Rotating square or circle. Neon Lime outline. Particles sucking inward.

principles: Bouncy. Use spring physics for hover states.
Glitchy. On 'Game Over' or 'Trap Trigger', the UI should shake or chromatic aberration for 0.2s.

images.description: Neon lines on black (Loading Screen / Level Select Bg)

instructions_to_main_agent: Add 'Chakra Petch' and 'Rajdhani' to 'index.html' or import in CSS.
Create a 'GameLayout' component that wraps the game canvas with the HUD.
Implement the 'Arena Editor' using a grid-based drag-and-drop system (no complex physics in editor, just placement).
Ensure the Game Canvas handles high-DPI (Retina) screens correctly for crisp rendering.
Use the provided hex codes for drawing on the Canvas API as well (maintain consistency between DOM UI and Canvas Game).
For the 'Level Devil' feel: Adding a subtle camera shake when the player dies is crucial.
UNIVERSAL_GUIDELINES: Do NOT use standard HTML buttons. Use the 'GameButton' style defined above.
Do NOT use white backgrounds. Always dark.
Every interaction (hover, click) must have visual feedback.
Use 'sonner' for in-game notifications (e.g., 'New Record!'). Style it dark.
